verses.kjv: Then Job answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Job responded:

verses.kjv: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all.
verses.ct: "I've listened to plenty of talk like this. You're all terrible at giving comfort.

verses.kjv: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?
verses.ct: Will these empty speeches ever stop? What drives you to keep arguing?

verses.kjv: I also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.
verses.ct: I could talk the same way you do. If you were in my position, I could pile up words against you and shake my head at you.

verses.kjv: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should asswage your grief.
verses.ct: But instead, I would encourage you with my words, and what I said would ease your pain.

verses.kjv: Though I speak, my grief is not asswaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?
verses.ct: Whether I speak or stay silent, nothing relieves my suffering either way.

verses.kjv: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.
verses.ct: But now God has worn me out. He has destroyed everyone close to me.

verses.kjv: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.
verses.ct: He has shriveled me up, and that itself testifies against me. My wasting body stands as evidence for all to see.

verses.kjv: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
verses.ct: God tears at me in his anger and treats me like an enemy. He grinds his teeth at me; my opponent glares at me with piercing eyes.

verses.kjv: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
verses.ct: People open their mouths wide to mock me. They slap my face to insult me. They band together to come against me.

verses.kjv: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.
verses.ct: God has handed me over to the ungodly and thrown me into the grip of the wicked.

verses.kjv: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
verses.ct: I was living in peace, but he shattered me. He grabbed me by the neck and crushed me, then set me up as his target.

verses.kjv: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
verses.ct: His archers surround me on every side. He splits open my organs without mercy and spills my bile on the ground.

verses.kjv: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.
verses.ct: He breaks through me again and again, charging at me like a warrior.

verses.kjv: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.
verses.ct: I've stitched rough cloth over my skin and buried my dignity in the dirt.

verses.kjv: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
verses.ct: My face is swollen from crying, and deep darkness hangs over my eyes—

verses.kjv: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.
verses.ct: even though my hands have done nothing violent, and my prayer has been sincere.

verses.kjv: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.
verses.ct: Earth, don't cover my blood! Don't let my cry for justice be silenced!

verses.kjv: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.
verses.ct: Even now, look—my witness is in heaven, and the one who can speak for me is on high.

verses.kjv: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
verses.ct: My friends ridicule me, but my eyes pour out tears to God.

verses.kjv: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour!
verses.ct: If only someone could argue my case before God, the way a person advocates for a neighbor!

verses.kjv: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
verses.ct: In just a few more years, I will travel a road from which I will never come back."
